Title: Verify Patient Registration
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully register on the application.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the registration form with valid details. 3. Submit the registration form.
Action: Submit the registration form.
Data: Valid patient details (e.g., name, email, password)
Result: The patient should be successfully registered and redirected to the login page.

Title: Verify Invalid Patient Registration
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid inputs during patient registration.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Fill in the registration form with invalid details (e.g., missing required fields). 3. Submit the registration form.
Action: Submit the registration form with invalid details.
Data: Invalid patient details (e.g., missing name, invalid email format)
Result: The system should display error messages for the invalid fields and not allow registration.

Title: Verify Doctor Appointment Booking
Description: Verify that a patient can successfully book an appointment with a doctor.
Precondition: The patient must be logged in.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Search for a doctor's information. 3. Select a specific time slot for the appointment. 4. Submit the appointment booking form.
Action: Submit the appointment booking form.
Data: Valid doctor information and time slot
Result: The system should confirm the appointment and calculate the waiting time.

Title: Verify Booking Appointment with Invalid Time Slot
Description: Verify that the system handles invalid time slot selection during appointment booking.
Precondition: The patient must be logged in.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the appointment booking page. 2. Search for a doctor's information. 3. Select an invalid time slot (e.g., already booked slot). 4. Submit the appointment booking form.
Action: Submit the appointment booking form with an invalid time slot.
Result: The system should display an error message indicating the time slot is not available.

Title: Verify Diagnostic Center Report Upload
Description: Verify that a diagnostic center can successfully upload patient reports.
Precondition: The diagnostic center must be logged in.
Steps: 1. Navigate to the report upload page. 2. Select a patient's record. 3. Upload the report file. 4. Submit the upload form.
Action: Submit the report upload form.
Result: The report should be successfully uploaded and associated with the patient's record.

Title: Performance Test - System Response Time Under Load
Description: Validate the system's response time when multiple users are accessing the application simultaneously.
Precondition: The application should be deployed in a staging environment with a load testing tool configured.
Steps: 1. Configure the load testing tool to simulate 1000 concurrent users. 2. Run the load test for 1 hour. 3. Monitor the system's response time for critical functionalities such as login, appointment booking, and report viewing.
Action: Simulate high user load and monitor response times.
Result: The system should maintain an average response time of less than 2 seconds for all critical functionalities.

Title: Security Test - Access Control for Different User Roles
Description: Verify that different user roles (Patient, Doctor, Diagnostic Center) have appropriate access levels.
Precondition: User accounts for Patient, Doctor, and Diagnostic Center roles should be created.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient and attempt to access Doctor and Diagnostic Center functionalities. 2. Log in as a Doctor and attempt to access Diagnostic Center functionalities. 3. Log in as a Diagnostic Center and attempt to access Patient and Doctor functionalities.
Action: Attempt to access functionalities outside of the user role's permissions.
Data: Valid credentials for each user role.
Result: The system should deny access to functionalities outside the user role's permissions.

Title: Usability Test - Ease of Navigation for Patients
Description: Ensure that patients can easily navigate and perform necessary functions using the application.
Precondition: The application should be deployed in a testing environment.
Steps: 1. Log in as a Patient. 2. Navigate to the appointment booking section. 3. Book an appointment with a doctor. 4. Navigate to the report viewing section. 5. View and download a report.
Action: Perform key patient functionalities.
Result: The patient should be able to complete all tasks without difficulty.

Title: Reliability Test - System Behavior Under Failure Conditions
Description: Assess the system's behavior when a critical component fails.
Precondition: The application should be deployed in a testing environment with monitoring tools configured.
Steps: 1. Simulate a database failure. 2. Monitor the system's behavior and error handling. 3. Restore the database and monitor the system's recovery process.
Action: Simulate and monitor system behavior under failure conditions.
Result: The system should handle the failure gracefully, display appropriate error messages, and recover within the specified mean time to recovery.

Title: Scalability Test - System Performance with Increased User Load
Description: Check the system's performance as the number of concurrent users increases.
Precondition: The application should be deployed in a staging environment with a load testing tool configured.
Steps: 1. Configure the load testing tool to simulate an increasing number of concurrent users (e.g., 100, 500, 1000, 2000). 2. Run the load test for each user load increment for 30 minutes. 3. Monitor the system's response time and resource utilization.
Action: Simulate increasing user load and monitor system performance.
Result: The system should maintain acceptable performance metrics (response time, resource utilization) as the user load increases.

Title: Validate User Login with Correct Credentials
Description: Verify that a user can successfully log in with valid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter valid username and password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter valid credentials and log in.
Result: The user should be successfully logged in and redirected to the dashboard.

Title: Attempt Login with Invalid Credentials
Description: Verify that the system prevents login with invalid credentials.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter an invalid username and/or password. 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter invalid credentials and attempt to log in.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test SQL Injection in Login Form
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to SQL injection attacks via the login form.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the login page. 2. Enter SQL injection payload in the username and/or password field (e.g., ' OR '1'='1). 3. Click the login button.
Action: Enter SQL injection payload and attempt to log in.
Result: The system should display an error message and prevent login.

Title: Test Session Hijacking
Description: Verify that the system is resistant to session hijacking by invalidating sessions upon logout.
Precondition: User is logged in.
Steps: 1. Log in with valid credentials. 2. Note the session ID from the browser cookies. 3. Log out from the application. 4. Attempt to access the application using the previously noted session ID.
Action: Attempt to access the application using a hijacked session ID.
Result: The system should invalidate the session and prompt the user to log in again.

Title: Test Data Exposure in URL Parameters
Description: Verify that sensitive data is not exposed in URL parameters.
Precondition: User is logged in and has access to sensitive data.
Steps: 1. Navigate to a page that displays sensitive data (e.g., patient records). 2. Observe the URL parameters. 3. Attempt to manipulate the URL parameters to access unauthorized data.
Action: Observe and manipulate URL parameters.
Result: The system should not expose sensitive data in URL parameters and should prevent unauthorized access.

Title: Load Test - Patient Registration
Description: Simulate multiple patients registering simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 100 virtual users. 2. Each user navigates to the registration page. 3. Each user fills out and submits the registration form with unique data.
Action: Simulate 100 virtual users registering simultaneously.
Data: Unique registration data for each virtual user.
Result: All users should successfully register within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 5 seconds).

Title: Stress Test - Doctor Appointment Booking
Description: Push the system beyond its limits by simulating a high number of concurrent appointment bookings.
Precondition: The application is up and running, and there are available appointment slots.
Steps: 1. Simulate 500 virtual users. 2. Each user searches for a doctor and views available appointment slots. 3. Each user books an appointment.
Action: Simulate 500 virtual users booking appointments concurrently.
Result: The system should handle the load without crashing, but response times may increase. Identify the breaking point.

Title: Endurance Test - Diagnostic Center Report Upload
Description: Evaluate the system's ability to sustain a prolonged load of report uploads by a diagnostic center.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Simulate 50 virtual users representing a diagnostic center. 2. Each user uploads reports continuously for 24 hours.
Action: Simulate 50 virtual users uploading reports continuously for 24 hours.
Result: The system should sustain the load without significant degradation in performance.

Title: Scalability Test - Increasing Number of Users
Description: Determine the system's ability to handle an increasing number of concurrent users.
Precondition: The application is up and running.
Steps: 1. Start with 100 virtual users. 2. Gradually increase the number of users by 100 every 30 minutes until 1000 users are reached. 3. Each user performs various actions such as logging in, searching for doctors, and booking appointments.
Action: Gradually increase the number of concurrent users from 100 to 1000.
Result: The system should handle the increasing load with acceptable performance degradation.

Title: Load Test - Patient Accessing Reports
Description: Simulate multiple patients accessing their reports simultaneously to assess the system's performance under normal conditions.
Precondition: The application is up and running, and there are reports available for patients.
Steps: 1. Simulate 200 virtual users. 2. Each user logs in and accesses their reports.
Action: Simulate 200 virtual users accessing their reports simultaneously.
Result: All users should be able to access their reports within an acceptable response time (e.g., < 3 seconds).

Title: Test Minimum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to create an account with the minimum password length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the sign-up page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with the minimum length (e.g., 8 characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with the minimum length and submit the form.
Data: Username: valid_username, Email: valid_email@example.com, Password: minLength8
Result: The system should allow the user to create an account successfully.

Title: Test Maximum Password Length
Description: Verify that the system allows a user to create an account with the maximum password length.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the sign-up page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with the maximum length (e.g., 20 characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with the maximum length and submit the form.
Data: Username: valid_username, Email: valid_email@example.com, Password: maxLength20
Result: The system should allow the user to create an account successfully.

Title: Test Password Length Just Below Minimum
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with a password length just below the minimum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the sign-up page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with a length just below the minimum (e.g., 7 characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with a length just below the minimum and submit the form.
Data: Username: valid_username, Email: valid_email@example.com, Password: belowMin7
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password is too short.

Title: Test Password Length Just Above Maximum
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with a password length just above the maximum.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the sign-up page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with a length just above the maximum (e.g., 21 characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with a length just above the maximum and submit the form.
Data: Username: valid_username, Email: valid_email@example.com, Password: aboveMax21
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password is too long.

Title: Test Invalid Password Format
Description: Verify that the system does not allow a user to create an account with an invalid password format.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the sign-up page. 2. Enter valid username, email, and other required fields. 3. Enter a password with an invalid format (e.g., no special characters). 4. Submit the form.
Action: Enter a password with an invalid format and submit the form.
Data: Username: valid_username, Email: valid_email@example.com, Password: invalidFormat
Result: The system should display an error message indicating that the password format is invalid.

Title: Verify Patient Data Privacy
Description: Ensure that patient data is securely stored and only accessible to authorized users.
Precondition: Patient data is available in the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. Navigate to the patient profile section. 3. Attempt to access another patient's data. 4. Log in as a doctor. 5. Attempt to access patient data. 6. Log in as a diagnostic center. 7. Attempt to access patient data.
Action: Access patient data from different user roles.
Data: Patient credentials, doctor credentials, diagnostic center credentials.
Result: The system should prevent unauthorized access to patient data.

Title: Validate Password Requirements
Description: Verify that the system enforces strong password policies.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Navigate to the registration page. 2. Enter a password that is less than 8 characters long. 3. Enter a password without special characters. 4. Enter a password that does not meet the recycling policy. 5. Enter a password that meets all requirements.
Action: Attempt to register with different password inputs.
Result: The system should only accept passwords that meet the length, special character, expiry, and recycling policies.

Title: Ensure Data Integrity During Inactivity Timeout
Description: Verify that the system maintains data integrity during inactivity timeouts.
Precondition: User is logged in and actively using the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as a patient. 2. Perform an action that modifies data (e.g., update profile information). 3. Leave the system idle for the inactivity timeout period. 4. Attempt to access the system again. 5. Verify that the data modifications are saved correctly.
Action: Leave the system idle and attempt to access it again.
Result: The system should maintain data integrity and save modifications correctly.

Title: Verify System Availability
Description: Ensure that the system is available 24/7 as per the requirement.
Precondition: None
Steps: 1. Attempt to access the system at various times throughout the day and night. 2. Verify that the system is functional and accessible.
Action: Access the system at different times.
Result: The system should be accessible and functional at all times.

Title: Validate Data Classification and System Accreditation
Description: Ensure that all data is protectively marked and stored according to regulations.
Precondition: Data is available in the system.
Steps: 1. Log in as an administrator. 2. Navigate to the data storage section. 3. Verify that all data is marked and stored according to protective measures. 4. Attempt to access sensitive data without proper authorization. 5. Verify that the system flags or prevents unauthorized access.
Action: Access and verify data classification and storage.
Result: The system should protectively mark and store all data, and prevent unauthorized access.
